text: Who among the following played a major role in the transmission of Hadiths?
explanation: A'ishah, the wife of Prophet Muhammad, played a significant role in the transmission of Hadiths. She narrated over 2000 hadiths, making her one of the most important narrators of Hadiths.

text: The supererogatory prayer with a single rak'ah is Salatul
explanation: Salatul Witr is a supererogatory prayer that is performed with a single rak'ah. It is usually performed after the Isha prayer and before the Fajr prayer.

text: The following are voluntary fasting except
explanation: Qada' is not a voluntary fast. It is the fast that is made up for a missed obligatory fast. Therefore, the correct answer is 'Qada'.

text: Voluntary fasting is encouraged on
explanation: Voluntary fasting is encouraged on Mondays and Thursdays in Islam. This is based on Hadiths from Prophet Muhammad (PBUH). Therefore, the correct answer is 'Mondays'.

text: The first King of the Mali empire to accept Islam was
explanation: He was the first Muslim ruler in West Africa to make the journey to Mecca.

text: Permanent exemption from Ramadan fast may be occasioned by
explanation: Permanent exemption from Ramadan fast may be occasioned by old age. According to Islamic jurisprudence, elderly people who find it extremely difficult to fast are allowed to break their fast and instead feed a poor person for each day they do not fast.

text: Quran 24:32 is an injunction which

options.A: allows a Muslim to divorce only when necessary
options.B: commands Muslims to marry more than one wife
options.D: enjoins Muslims to marry righteous partners

explanation: Quran 24:32 is an injunction which enjoins Muslims to marry righteous partners. The verse says: 'And marry the unmarried among you and the righteous among your male slaves and female slaves. If they should be poor, Allah will enrich them from His bounty, and Allah is all-Encompassing and Knowing.' It neither discourages a Muslim from polygamy, commands Muslims to marry more than one wife, nor allows a Muslim to divorce only when necessary.

text: The goddesses of the Jahiliyyah Arabs include
explanation: The goddesses of the Jahiliyyah Arabs include al-Lat, al-Manat, and al-Uzzah. However, as-samad is not a goddess of the Jahiliyyah Arabs. As-Samad is one of the names of Allah, mentioned in Surah Al-Ikhlas.

text: Which of the following is not a form of shirk according to the Quran?

options.A: Which of the following is not a form of shirk according to the Quran?

explanation: Monotheism, the belief in one God, is not a form of shirk according to the Quran. Shirk, in Islam, is the sin of practicing idolatry or polytheism, i.e., the deification or worship of anyone or anything other than the singular God. Therefore, Trinity (belief in Father, Son, and Holy Spirit as three persons in one God), Polytheism (belief in many gods), and Atheism (disbelief in the existence of God or gods) can be considered forms of shirk.

text: When Muhammad(S.A.W) sought for protection in Ta'if in 620 C.E. he was

options.A: stoned by the people of Ta'if
options.D: allowed to stay for a few days

explanation: When Prophet Muhammad (S.A.W) sought protection in Ta'if in 620 C.E., he was stoned and chased out of the city by the people of Ta'if. This event is known as the 'Year of Sorrow' in Islamic history.

text: The reign of Caliph Uthman b. Affan is known for
explanation: The reign of Caliph Uthman b. Affan is known for the standardization of the Qur'an. He commissioned a committee to produce a standard copy of the text, which is known as the Uthmanic codex.

text: How many times does the word al-Qadr occur in the Qur'an chapter 97?
explanation: The word al-Qadr occurs 3 times in the Qur'an chapter 97. Al-Qadr is an Arabic word that means 'The Night of Decree' or 'The Night of Power'. It is a special night in the month of Ramadan when the first verses of the Quran were revealed to the Prophet Muhammad.

text: The capital of an ancient Ghana empire was
explanation: The capital of the ancient Ghana Empire was Awkar. The Ghana Empire was a West African empire located in the area of present-day southeastern Mauritania and western Mali. Therefore, the correct answer is 'Awkar'.

text: According to the Hadith of the Prophet(S.A.W.), learning is obligatory for both the
explanation: According to a Hadith of Prophet Muhammad (S.A.W.), 'Seeking knowledge is an obligation upon every Muslim, male and female.' Therefore, the correct answer is 'Male and Female'.

text: "Lam yalid wa lam yulad"(Q 112:3) is preceded by
explanation: "Lam yalid wa lam yulad"(Q 112:3) is preceded by "Allahu Samad"(Q 112:2). This is a verse from the Quran, Surah Al-Ikhlas. The verse "Lam yalid wa lam yulad" translates to "He begets not, nor is He begotten" and the preceding verse "Allahu Samad" translates to "Allah, the Eternal Refuge".

text: Suratud-Duha (Q.93) in the Quran has a total of 11 verses. Therefore, without the last verse, the remaining verses are 10.
explanation: Suratud-Duha (Q.93) in the Quran has a total of 11 verses. Therefore, without the last verse, the remaining verses are 10.

text: In the science of Hadith, the next Sahih to authenticity is
explanation: In the science of Hadith, the classification of Hadiths in terms of authenticity is as follows: Sahih (Authentic), Hasan (Good), and Da'if (Weak). Therefore, the next to Sahih in terms of authenticity is Hasan.

text: Imam Bukhari is to 870 C.E. as Imam Muslim is to
explanation: Imam Muslim, a prominent scholar of Hadith, was born in 817 CE and died in 875 CE. However, his most significant work, Sahih Muslim, was completed in 888 CE.

text: The number of Rakah in the obligatory prayers of Friday is
explanation: Fajr = 2Jummah = 2Asr = 4Magrib = 3Ishai = 4

text: Which of the following is the greatest form of Jihad according to the Prophet(S.A.W.)?

options.C: waging war in the course of A llah

explanation: The greatest form of Jihad according to the Prophet Muhammad (S.A.W.) is suppressing one's selfish desires. This is often referred to as the 'greater jihad', the struggle against the lower self (nafs). The 'lesser jihad' is the physical struggle against the enemies of Islam.

text: A major lesson contained in Hadith 16 of an-Nawawi is
explanation: Hadith 16 of an-Nawawi is about controlling anger. The Hadith says: 'I asked the Messenger of Allah: Who is the best among the people? He replied, 'The one who, when you look at him, you remember Allah.' Then I asked: Then who? He replied, 'The one who does not harm the Muslims with his tongue and hands.' Then I asked: Then who? He replied, 'The one who controls his anger.'

text: Makkah is referred to in the Quran chapter 95 verse 3 as the city of
explanation: In the Quran chapter 95 verse 3, Makkah is referred to as the city of security. The verse says 'And [by] this secure city [Makkah],' Therefore, the correct answer is 'security'.

text: The Tahajjud is observed between
explanation: The Tahajjud prayer is observed between Isha (night prayer) and Fajr (dawn prayer). It is a voluntary prayer and is highly recommended in Islam.

text: The following Suwar begin with divine command to the Prophet except Surah
explanation: Surah ad-Duha does not begin with a divine command to the Prophet. It begins with an oath by the morning light (Duha) and the night when it settles. The other Surahs listed (an-Nas, al-Falaq, al-Kafirun) all begin with a command or a statement to the Prophet.

text: A Juz' of the Quran is subdivided into the following except
explanation: A Juz' of the Quran is subdivided into Hizb, Nisf, and Rub'. Manzil is not a subdivision of a Juz'. Instead, the Quran is divided into seven Manzil to allow for it to be read over a week.

text: "La Taghdab" in Hadith 16 means
explanation: "La Taghdab" in Hadith 16 means "do not get angry". This is a part of a Hadith where a man asked the Prophet for advice and he replied, "Do not get angry".

text: The Surah which beins with four oaths is
explanation: The Surah which begins with four oaths is Surah at-Tin (The Fig). The Surah starts with the verses "By the fig and the olive, And [by] Mount Sinai, And [by] this secure city [Makkah]," which are considered as oaths.

text: Imam an-Nasal spent his days in
explanation: Imam an-Nasai, a notable Hadith scholar, spent his days in Khurasan. He was born in the city of Nasa in present-day Turkmenistan, and he spent most of his life studying and teaching Hadith in the region of Khurasan.

text: Which of the following is an exclusive obligation of the husband?
explanation: In Islam, the provision of shelter is an exclusive obligation of the husband. This is part of the financial responsibilities of the husband towards his wife, which also includes providing food and clothing. Counselling, provision of job, and domestic support are not exclusive obligations of the husband.

text: The last verse of Suratut-Tin describes Allah as the
explanation: The last verse of Suratut-Tin describes Allah as the 'Judge'. The verse is 'Is not Allah the most just of judges?' (Surah At-Tin, 95:8). Therefore, the correct answer is 'Judge'.

text: Muslims should pay more attention to Hadith 5 of an-Nawawi because it
explanation: It discourages innovation in religion.

text: The major teaching of Hadith 5 of an-Nawawi centres on
explanation: On the authority of Aishah, who said: The messenger of Allah said: p "He who innovates something in this matter of ours that is not of it will have it rejected." And in one version by Muslim it reads : "He who does an act which our matter is not in agreement with will have it rejected.

text: To seek divine guidance, Muslims are encouraged to perform Salat
explanation: Salat Istikhara is a prayer for seeking divine guidance in decision-making. It is recommended when a Muslim is making a decision and seeks the guidance of Allah. Therefore, the correct answer is 'Istikhara'.

text: Suratul Fatihah(Q.1:5) admonishes

options.B: appreciate the mercy and grace of Allah
options.C: give thanks and praises to Allah

explanation: Suratul Fatihah (Q.1:5) is the first chapter of the Quran and it emphasizes the worship of Allah alone. The verse says 'You alone we worship, and You alone we ask for help.' Therefore, the correct answer is 'Worship none except Almighty Allah'.

text: A muslim is only permitted to marry his
explanation: According to Islamic law, a Muslim man is permitted to marry his late wife's sister. However, he is not permitted to marry his foster mother, his late father's wife, or his foster sister.

text: The state into which the pilgrim enters befire the time of Hajj is
explanation: The state into which the pilgrim enters before the time of Hajj is called Ihram. Ihram is a sacred state which a Muslim must enter in order to perform the major pilgrimage (Hajj) or the minor pilgrimage (Umrah).

text: Halimah, the wet nurse of Muhammad(S.A.W.) hailed from the Banu
explanation: Halimah, the wet nurse of Prophet Muhammad (S.A.W.), hailed from the Banu Sa'ad tribe. This tribe was known for its generosity and hospitality.

text: The major teaching of Surah an-Nasr(Q. 110) is that

options.C: man must strive to succeed in life

explanation: Surah an-Nasr (Q. 110) discusses the victory of Islam and the rapid expansion of the Muslim community. Therefore, the major teaching of this Surah is that Islam has a bright future.

text: The Prophet lost his wife Khadijah in the year
explanation: The Prophet Muhammad lost his wife Khadijah in the year 619 C.E. This year is also known as the 'Year of Sorrow' in Islamic history due to the passing of both Khadijah and Muhammad's uncle, Abu Talib.

text: The weakest of faith according to Hadith 34 of an-Nawawi is changig an evil with the
explanation: According to Hadith 34 of an-Nawawi, the weakest form of faith is changing an evil with the heart, which means hating it and feeling that it is wrong. This is considered the least that can be done when encountering evil.

text: The first Mu'adh-Dhin in Islam is
explanation: The first Mu'adh-Dhin in Islam is Bilal. Bilal ibn Rabah was a companion of the Prophet Muhammad and the first man to call Muslims to prayer, known as the Adhan, making him the first Mu'adh-Dhin in Islam.

text: Which of the following was not a Jahilliyyah idol?
explanation: The Jahilliyyah period refers to the time of ignorance before the advent of Islam in Arabia. During this period, the Arabs worshipped several idols, including al-Manat, al-Uzzah, and al-Lat. However, al-Jibl is not known to be one of the Jahilliyyah idols.

text: The work of Imam Bukhari and al-Tirmidhi are both called
explanation: The works of Imam Bukhari and al-Tirmidhi are both called 'Jami'. Jami is a term used for a collection of hadiths, which are sayings, actions or approvals of the Prophet Muhammad.

text: Alaysal-Llahu biahkamil-Hakimin implies that Allahi is the best
explanation: The phrase 'Alaysal-Llahu biahkamil-Hakimin' is from the Quran (95:8) and it translates to 'Is not Allah the most just of judges?'. Therefore, it implies that Allah is the best Judge.

text: The following are lessons of Hadith 5 of an-Nawawi except
explanation: On the authority of Aishah, who said : The messenger of Allah said: p "He who innovates something in this matter of ours that is not of it will have it rejected."

text: The admonition of the last part of Hadith 18 of an-Nawawi is
explanation: Have taqwa (fear) of Allah wherever you may be, and follow up a bad deed with a good deed which will wipe it out, and behave well towards the people.

text: The following nullifies an Islamic marriage if it is not fulfilled except
explanation: The following nullifies an Islamic marriage if it is not fulfilled except marriage feast. In Islamic law, the marriage feast (Walima) is a Sunnah (practice of the Prophet) and not a requirement for the validity of the marriage.

text: The number of Makkan soldiers that took part in the battle of Uhud was
explanation: The Battle of Uhud was a significant battle in early Islamic history, taking place in 625 C.E. The Makkan army that fought against the Muslims in this battle was made up of approximately 3000 soldiers.

text: Maliki yawmid-Din is translated as

options.A: guide us through the right path
options.B: praise be to Allah, the Lord of the Worlds
options.D: the King of the Day of Judgement

explanation: 'Maliki yawmid-Din' is a phrase from the Quran which translates to 'the King of the Day of Judgement'. It is part of the first chapter of the Quran, Al-Fatiha.

text: Ad-Dhikr is to the Qur'an as Ummul-Kitab is to
explanation: Ad-Dhikr is another name for the Qur'an, and Ummul-Kitab (Mother of the Book) is another name for Surah Al-Fatihah. Therefore, Ad-Dhikr is to the Qur'an as Ummul-Kitab is to Fatihah.

text: Subhana rabbiyal -A'la faghfir li is recited when the worshipper is at
explanation: The phrase 'Subhana rabbiyal -A'la faghfir li' is recited during the act of sujud (prostration) in the Islamic prayer. Therefore, the correct answer is 'sujud'.

text: The following are classifications of Hadith except
explanation: The term 'hasam' is not a classification of Hadith. The Hadiths are classified into 'sahih' (authentic), 'daif' (weak), and 'mawdu' (fabricated).

text: Ijma' as a secondary source of Islamic law implies
explanation: Ijma' is an Arabic term referring generally to the consensus or agreement of the Muslim scholars basically on religious issues. It is considered the third fundamental source of Islamic law, after the Qur'an and Sunnah.

text: Tayammum is performed by a Muslim when

options.B: he wants to join a congregational prayer
options.C: access to water is very difficult
options.D: he is in a hurry to perform prayer

explanation: Tayammum is a dry ablution in Islamic ritual purification for prayer, which involves the use of clean soil or dust when water is not available or cannot be used for reasons such as illness. Therefore, the correct answer is 'access to water is very difficult'.

text: A complete prayer ends with
explanation: A complete Islamic prayer (Salah) ends with Taslim. Taslim is the part where the person praying turns their head to the right and then to the left, saying 'Assalamu alaikum wa rahmatullah' each time, which means 'Peace be upon you and God's mercy'.

text: The first pledge of Aqabah was signed in
explanation: The first pledge of Aqabah, also known as the First Pledge of Allegiance at al-Aqabah, was an agreement between the Islamic prophet Muhammad and twelve men from Yathrib (now Medina). This event took place in 621 C.E.

text: The unity of Allah is expressed in Suratul -
explanation: The unity of Allah is expressed in Suratul Ikhlas. This Surah (chapter) of the Quran is often translated as 'The Sincerity' and it emphasizes the oneness and singularity of Allah.

text: The Prophet's uncle who succeeded Abu Talib as the Head of the Banu Hashum was
explanation: The Prophet's uncle who succeeded Abu Talib as the Head of the Banu Hashum was Hamzah.

text: The Qur'an was initially preserved on the following except
explanation: The Qur'an was initially preserved through memory, on leather, and on rocks. Paper was not used for the initial preservation of the Qur'an.

text: Lawhul-Mahfudh is associated with Quranic
explanation: Lawhul-Mahfudh is associated with Quranic preservation. It is believed to be the 'Preserved Tablet' in the heavens where everything that has happened and will happen is recorded. This concept is related to the divine predestination and preservation of the Quran.

text: Marriage relationship fulfils the following functions except
explanation: Marriage in Islam serves several purposes, including sexual satisfaction, forming the foundation of family life, and providing security in old age. However, it is not considered a quick means of getting rich. Therefore, the statement 'quick means of getting rich' is not a function of marriage.

text: Khadijah married Muhammad(S.A.W.) at the age of
explanation: Khadijah married Prophet Muhammad (S.A.W.) when she was 40 years old. This is a well-known fact in Islamic history.

text: The last child of Prophet Muhammad(S.A.W) is
explanation: The last child of Prophet Muhammad (S.A.W) was Ibrahim, who was born to Maria al-Qibtiyya. He lived for about 16 to 18 months and then died.

text: The Qur'an is to Muhammad(S.A.W.) as Suhuf is to
explanation: The Qur'an was revealed to Prophet Muhammad (S.A.W.), and the Suhuf (Scrolls) were revealed to Prophet Ibrahim (A.S). Therefore, the Qur'an is to Muhammad (S.A.W.) as Suhuf is to Ibrahim (A.S).

text: An Hadith is referred to as da'if because

options.A: it has defects in its isnad and matn
options.B: it is sometimes supported with evidences

explanation: A Hadith is referred to as da'if (weak) because it has defects in its isnad (chain of narrators) and matn (content). This means that there may be issues with the reliability of the narrators or inconsistencies in the content of the Hadith.

text: Talaq al-Bida'ah takes effect when divorce is pronounced

options.A: when the wife is still in her marital home
options.B: when the wife is purified of her menses

explanation: Talaq al-Bida'ah, also known as the innovated divorce, takes effect when divorce is pronounced three times simultaneously. This practice is considered to be against the teachings of Prophet Muhammad (S.A.W) as it does not allow for the period of reconciliation that is recommended in Islam.

text: Which of the following prayers is not observed between Isha and Fajr?
explanation: Istisqa is a prayer for rain in the Islamic tradition. It is not observed between Isha and Fajr. On the other hand, Tahajjud, Shafi, and Witr are prayers that are observed during this period.

text: The fifty Muslim archers at the battle of Uhud were instructed to

options.B: strike first in order to gain war booty
options.C: attack the enemies when facing them
options.D: stay there and should not leave their post

explanation: The fifty Muslim archers at the battle of Uhud were instructed by Prophet Muhammad (S.A.W) to stay at their post and not to leave, regardless of the situation on the battlefield. Their failure to adhere to this instruction led to the Muslims' defeat in the battle.

text: Al-Akhirah is to hereafter as Al-Qiyammah is to
explanation: In Islamic eschatology, Al-Akhirah is the term for the afterlife, and Al-Qiyammah is the term for the Day of Resurrection. Therefore, the correct answer is 'Resurrection'.

text: The type of Ghusl performed by a ew convert to Islam is
explanation: When a person converts to Islam, they are required to perform Ghusl (ritual purification) known as Ghusl al-Islam or Dhukil-al-Islam. Therefore, the correct answer is 'Dhukil-al-Islam'.

text: A rak'ah in salat starts with
explanation: A rak'ah in salat starts with Takbiratul Ihram. Takbiratul Ihram is the first Takbir (saying 'Allahu Akbar') in the prayer which marks the beginning of the prayer.

text: One of the issues discussed in Hadith 18 of an-Nawawi is about
explanation: Have taqwa (fear) of Allah wherever you may be, and follow up a bad deed with a good deed which will wipe it out, and behave well towards the people. It was related by at-Tirmidhi, who said it was a hasan (good) hadeeth, and in some copies it is stated to be a hasan saheeh hadeeth.

text: Reference is made to the migration of 622 C.E. in an-Nawawi's Hadith
explanation: The migration referred to in an-Nawawi's Hadith is the Hijrah, which took place in 622 C.E. This was when Prophet Muhammad and his followers migrated from Mecca to Medina. The Hijrah marks the beginning of the Islamic calendar, hence it is often referred to in Islamic literature.

text: Which of the following is not among the articles of Faith? Belief in the
explanation: The articles of Faith in Islam include belief in the angels, prophets, and scriptures. However, belief in miracles is not considered an article of Faith. While miracles are recognized in Islam, they are not a separate category of belief.

text: Iqra' warabbukal' akram is followed by
explanation: The phrase 'Iqra' warabbukal' akram' is from the first revelation of the Quran to Prophet Muhammad. It is followed by 'Alladhi' alama bil qalam', which translates to 'Who taught by the pen'.

text: The main means of transport used by the Arabs in the desert was
explanation: During the pre-Islamic period, the main means of transport used by the Arabs in the desert was the camel. Camels are well-adapted to the harsh desert conditions and were used for long-distance travel, carrying heavy loads, and even as a source of food and milk.
